'Pemphigoid' is a group of uncommon and rare autoimmune blistering skin
diseases. As its name indicates, pemphigoid is similar in general appearance to
pemphigus, but, unlike pemphigus, pemphigoid does not feature
acantholysis.

Pemphigoid is more common than pemphigus, and is slightly more common in women
than in men. It is also more common in people over 60 years of age than it is in
younger people.
